t: 1 Timothy 6
Let*p as many servants as are under the yoke count their own masters worthy of all honour, that the name of God and his doctrine be not blasphemed.

And*p they that have believing masters, let them not despise them, because they are brethren; but rather do them service, because they are faithful and beloved, partakers of the benefit. These things teach and exhort.
If*p any man teach otherwise, and consent not to wholesome words, even the words of our Lord Jesus Christ, and to the doctrine which is according to godliness;
He*p is proud, knowing nothing, but doting about questions and strifes of words, whereof cometh envy, strife, railings, evil surmisings,
Perverse*p disputings of men of corrupt minds, and destitute of the truth, supposing that gain is godliness: from such withdraw thyself.
But*p godliness with contentment is great gain.
For*p we brought nothing into this world, and it is certain we can carry nothing out.
And*p having food and raiment let us be therewith content.
But*p they that will be rich fall into temptation and a snare, and into many foolish and hurtful lusts, which drown men in destruction and perdition.
For*p the love of money is the root of all evil: which while some coveted after, they have erred from the faith, and pierced themselves through with many sorrows.
But*p thou, O man of God, flee these things; and follow after righteousness, godliness, faith, love, patience, meekness.
Fight*p the good fight of faith, lay hold on eternal life, whereunto thou art also called, and hast professed a good profession before many witnesses.
I*p give thee charge in the sight of God, who quickeneth all things, and before Christ Jesus, who before Pontius Pilate witnessed a good confession;
That*p thou keep this commandment without spot, unrebukeable, until the appearing of our Lord Jesus Christ:
Which*p in his times he shall shew, who is the blessed and only Potentate, the King of kings, and Lord of lords;
Who*p only hath immortality, dwelling in the light which no man can approach unto; whom no man hath seen, nor can see: to whom be honour and power everlasting. Amen.
Charge*p them that are rich in this world, that they be not highminded, nor trust in uncertain riches, but in the living God, who giveth us richly all things to enjoy;
That*p they do good, that they be rich in good works, ready to distribute, willing to communicate;
Laying*p up in store for themselves a good foundation against the time to come, that they may lay hold on eternal life.
O*p Timothy, keep that which is committed to thy trust, avoiding profane and vain babblings, and oppositions of science falsely so called:
Which*p some professing have erred concerning the faith. Grace be with thee. Amen.
